title.narrative: Support to Caritas Internationalis Emergency Protocols and Framework

description.narrative: Caritas Internationalis has a system of support to Members who are responding to crises, through the CI Emergency Response Framework. The latter also includes support to EAs (and otherwise, like capacity building and training) by the Sectoral WGs. This project is aimed at supporting Emergency Appeals other National Caritas activities financially, including being part of CI’s ERF, being part of the SWGs, including deployments. CI requests SWG members to offer up to 20% of their time to coordination, deployments and capacity building activities.

Strengthen the capacities of all elements of the Caritas Internationalis Response Framework
Localisation of our and CI’s Humanitarian Response work
Build stronger relationships in the Caritas Internationalis Network for enhance implementation of Cordaid (Emergency) activities and new funding opportunities through other CIMOs.
People in need supported through Caritas Internationalis Emergency Protocols and Framework

mailing-address.narrative: Grote Marktstraat 45, Den Haag, Zuid Holland, 2511 BH

title.narrative: Saving Lives Corporate Indicators
SHL-I4: Number of people provided with non-food items (other than hygiene/dignity kits)

description.narrative: Distribution of Non-Food Items. All household materials excluding those that fall under hygiene/dignity kits or direct shelter items. Also excludes unrestricted cash, which is to be put under indicator CSH-I1 or CSH-I2. However, if cash is provided for the purpose of buying household items, it should be put under this indicator (i.e. restricted cash).

title.narrative: Strengthened Health Systems and Access to Resilient Health Services
Number of people trained to provide COVID-19 Awareness Raising & Prevention activities
Number of people reached through COVID-19 Awareness Raising & Prevention activities
Number of health facilities with (improved) access to clean water in response to COVID-19

description.narrative: Facilities with functional handwashing points, drinking water, and latrines (KRI Definition: Number of health facilities rehabilitated)

title.narrative: Number of health facilities supported with PPE in response to COVID-19

description.narrative: no. of health Facilities equipped with Person Protective Equipment for Health Staff

title.narrative: Number of health facilities with improved infection prevention and waste management in response to COVID-19

description.narrative: Facilities with functional Waste Management System which include Waste segregation handle transportation disposal (KRI Definition: Number of health facilities rehabilitated)

Mental and psychosocial support
HEA-I2: Number of mental health consultations

description.narrative: Number of psychological and/or psychiatric consultations provided by a skilled provider. Skilled provider: medical or paramedical degree with supplementary training on mental health

title.narrative: Non-food items
SHL-I4: Number of people provided with non-food items (other than hygiene/dignity kits)

description.narrative: Distribution of Non-Food Items. All household materials excluding those that fall under hygiene/dignity kits or direct shelter items. Also excludes unrestricted cash, which is to be put under indicator CSH-I1 or CSH-I2. However, if cash is provided for the purpose of buying household items, it should be put under this indicator (i.e. restricted cash).
